channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLmoneyAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: As her kids turn 18, Angelina Jolie may be looking to sell her historic $24.5 million L.A. estate
item.description: Jolie is said to be getting ready to sell the home she has lived in for the last 8 years—as she prepares for a move away from the U.S.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg rankles neighbors for buying up cluster of Palo Alto homes
item.description: In the years since buying his first home there, Zuckerberg has purchased 10 others in an apparent bid to create a kind of property buffer.

item.title: This Fed watcher says a September rate cut is not yet a done deal — and a ‘messy’ compromise awaits
item.description: Changing labor market dynamics and sticky inflation suggest rate traders may be too optimistic about the pace of Fed rate cuts.

item.title: My aunt barely spends any money. Will we receive the contents of her safe-deposit box when she dies?
item.description: “I am asking for my mom, who is on a fixed income. It would be a nice boon.”

item.title: Are Tesla and Google stocks received as a gift subject to division in a divorce?
item.description: “My friend is working on an exit plan.”
